But some, they linger. They yearn for more, driven by grief, by curiosity, by a hunger that can never be satiated.

A fleeting vision, a whispered memory, a touch of cold on their skin. Enough to tantalize, to haunt their waking hours, to leave them forever changed.

For I am the boundary, the thin membrane between worlds. I am the echo of what was, the promise of what might be.

And I will not be controlled.
